event: Applying to Law Schools
description: I am currently applying to law schools, with an interest in [[intellectual property::A work or invention that is the result of creativity, such as a manuscript or a design, to which one has rights and for which one may apply for a patent, copyright, trademark, etc.]] and [[technology law::A broad branch of law dealing with the legal aspects of technology, the internet, intellectual property, and digital innovations.]].

event: Joined {{Digital Science::A technology company with its headquarters in London, England, and which focuses on strategic investments into startup companies that support the research lifecycle.}} as a Software Engineer
description: Started a new role focusing on software development for webapps and services for the {{National Institutes of Health::The primary agency of the United States federal government responsible for biomedical and public health research.}}.

event: Developed Cyforge-Flow
description: Released a rapid-prototyping tool based on my open-sourced Cyforge module.

event: Developed Cyforge for Python
description: Published a Python module available on [PyPI](https://pypi.org/project/cyforge/) for designing modular AI systems.

event: Developed and trained an [[LLM (large language model):: A model of the human brain's ability to produce natural language, trained with self-supervised machine learning on a vast amount of text, designed for natural language processing tasks, especially language generation.]] and chatbot
description: Created an assistant based on previous experience with parallel processing and model training.

event: Ran my first Half Marathon
description: Participated in Boston's Run to Remember Half Marathon.

event: Completed #[Boston University Paralegal Studies Certification::something cool]
description: Finished a 14-week online program to learn how to use legal technologies and tools, and to gain fundamental legal research skills.

event: Graduated from Northeastern University Honors College of Engineering BS/MS Program
description: Left with a combined Bachelor's in Computer Engineering and Computer Science, and a Master's in Electrical and Computer Engineering with a concentration in Computer Systems.

event: Started at Dell Technologies as a Software Engineer II
description: Following my internship, accepted a full-time position while finishing my BS/MS program.

event: Completed DeepLift capstone project for Northeastern University
description: Worked with a team of other students to develop a fitness mirror with a custom-built computer vision system and phone app to track and analyze user performance. We used a Jetson Xavier NX, OpenCV, and TensorFlow to create a real-time feedback system for users.

event: Started at Dell Technologies as a Storage Graduate Intern
description: Started a summer internship, where I worked to develop automated testing tools for Dell's storage systems.

event: Joined Draper Laboratory as a Machine Intelligence Co-op
description: Joined the Machine Intelligence Group, where I worked developing computer vision and machine learning algorithms for autonomous ocean buoys. We hoped for pictures of submarines, but we mostly found seals and other marine life.

event: Elected Treasurer of Northeastern University's Beta Gamma Epsilon Alpha Chapter
description: Took responsibility of my engineering fraternity's finances for the year of our centennial commemoration (founded February 12, 1919).

event: Became a Course Assistant for Accelerated Fundamentals of Computer Science II
description: Began working for another computer science course.

event: Started at Waters Corporation as a Software Engineering Co-op
description: Took a co-op position at Waters Corporation, where I developed tests for High Performance Liquid Chromatography (HPLC) systems' software.

event: Became a Teaching Assistant for Discrete Structures
description: Took the opportunity to lead weekly recitations (small, focused lectures) in addition to grading and tutoring.

event: Published in the 2017 #[ASEE::The American Society for Engineering Education (ASEE) is a non-profit member association, founded in 1893, dedicated to promoting and improving engineering and engineering technology education. The purpose of ASEE is the advancement of education in all of its functions which pertain to engineering and allied branches of science and technology, including the processes of teaching and learning, counseling, research, extension services and public relations.]-NE Conference Proceedings
description: Co-authored a paper with a professor and other first-year engineering students: [*Renewable Energy Generation from Footsteps using Piezoelectronics*](https://asee-ne.org/conferences/aseene/2017/index.php/aseene/aseene2017/paper/view/11).

event: Entered at Northeastern University Honors Program as an Undeclared Engineering Student
description: In pursuit of a law career focused in technology, decided to study engineering. I would later declare my major as combined Computer Engineering and Computer Science.

event: Graduated from #[Milford High School::todo]
description: Ranked 5th / approx. 300, as an #[AP Scholar with Distinction::Granted to students who receive an average score of at least 3.5 on all AP Exams taken, and scores of 3 or higher on five or more of these exams.], president of the #[National Honors Society::One of the oldest, largest, and most widely recognized cocurricular student organizations in American high schools, with 1.4 million members. The purpose of the NHS is to create enthusiasm for scholarship, to recognize outstanding students, to stimulate a desire to render service, to promote leadership, and to develop character in the students of secondary schools.], captain of the #[MBA Mock Trial Team::Places high school teams from across Massachusetts in simulated courtroom situations where students assume the roles of lawyers, defendants and witnesses in hypothetical cases. More than 1,000 students across the state participate in the competition, and more than 100 lawyers from communities around the state preside over the mock trials as judges, and coaches for the students.], president of the #[Junior State of America::Formerly the Junior Statesmen of America, abbreviated JSA, was an American non-partisan youth organization. The purpose of JSA was to help high school students acquire leadership skills and the knowledge necessary to be effective debaters and civic participants. JSA was sponsored by the Junior State of America Foundation Inc. (JSAF, a 501c(3) non-profit corporation), which also operated the JSA Summer Schools. On August 2nd, 2024, it was announced that the organization would be closing and ceasing operations on August 31, 2024.] chapter, member of the #[Tri-M Music Honors Society::todo], member of the #[Central District MMEA Choir::todo] ([[baritone::todo]]), varsity tennis player, theater member, and {{pinchaser::A person who performs maintenance and repairs on bowling alley pinsetters, clearing jams and resetting machines.}}.

event: Started at PINZ Entertainment as a {{Pinchaser::A person who performs maintenance and repairs on bowling alley pinsetters, clearing jams and resetting machines.}}
description: Joined the gaming staff at my local bowling alley, and became an experienced bowling mechanic over college summers, fixing the pinspotters, laser tag systems, and arcade machines. I bowled a 216 once and retired.

event: Started at Five Guys Burgers and Fries as a Crew Member
description: Got my first job as a cashier and line cook, learning how to grill the meanest burger west of I-495.

event: Began learning Piano
description: Was gifted a keyboard after joining my high school's theater program. I've been playing ever since. My favorite song to play is [Nocturne Op. 55 No. 1](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NONg06Pf0v8).
